meanings.definition: Administer an anesthetic to (a person or animal) to induce a state of insensitivity to pain.
meanings.sent1: The dentist will anesthetize my gums before filling the cavity.
meanings.sent2: The doctor decided to anesthetize the patient before the surgery.
meanings.sent3: I joked that I wanted to anesthetize my alarm clock to sleep longer.
meanings.sent4: The soothing music seemed to anesthetize my worries for a while.
meanings.sent5: The numbing spray will anesthetize your skin before the injection.

meanings.sent1: The cold weather seemed to anesthetize my fingers.
meanings.sent2: The shocking news can anesthetize a person's emotions temporarily.
meanings.sent3: I playfully said that the boring lecture would anesthetize me into a nap.
meanings.sent4: The monotonous task seemed to anesthetize my brain with boredom.
meanings.sent5: The endless waiting can anesthetize one's patience over time.
